section.title: Updating the MoM Policy on Hosts in a Cluster
section.para: The Memory Overcommit Manager handles memory balloon and KSM functions on a host. Changes to these functions at the cluster level are only passed to hosts the next time a host moves to a status of Up after being rebooted or in maintenance mode. However, if necessary you can apply important changes to a host immediately by synchronizing the MoM policy while the host is Up. The following procedure must be performed on each host individually.

procedure.title: Synchronizing MoM Policy on a Host

step.para: Click the Clusters tab and select the cluster to which the host belongs.
Click the Hosts tab in the details pane and select the host that requires an updated MoM policy.

section.para: The MoM policy on the host is updated without having to move the host to maintenance mode and back Up.
